Articles.Content:
For those of you who managed to visit both moons with one flight i\'d like do challenge you to do it several times..

As far as I calculate you need an delta v of ~1200 for every jump so it must be possible to switch the moon\'s more than 5 times..

please post every usefull hint how you jump and aim - i didn\'t jet find a way to manage the jump fast and efficent

part of your issue may be the 'Fast' part. If you want efficient, it wont be fast. 

When I went minimus to mun I put myself in a circular orbit just below the mun and waited days for the orbit to catch up, to save fuel.
Just went to each moon twice and then landed at Kerbin. It took 67 days.

> 
> When I went minimus to mun I put myself in a circular orbit just below the mun and waited days for the orbit to catch up, to save fuel.

More efficient to use a highly elliptical orbit; you don\'t have to make that circularization burn. It also makes the period of your orbit and that of Mun radically different, so you don\'t have to wait so long for it to catch you.

That\'s the technique I use because I\'m no good at eyeballing when the Mun will be where.
In the latest version (0.15) it tells you where you will be captured by the mun/kerbol/minmus/kerbin
